newsitem.title: USA: US spot resids lose ground with crude, soft demand.
newsitem.headline: US spot resids lose ground with crude, soft demand.

text.p: U.S. spot residual fuel prices lost ground Wednesday in moderate trade, finally undermined by soft utility demand and a sinking crude market, industry sources said.
"People are starting to think the market has to head South. There's no demand," said a cash trader, noting mild weather and fuel switching to cheaper gas slowed utility burns.

New York Harbor prompt one percent slipped 15 cents to $17.50 a barrel, with Sept 9-15 barrels offered at that number. Traders said September one percent paper quotes were straddling $17, off 25 cents on the day with crude.
